creator: robert.vanderveer@telecom.tno.nl
text:
I set my driver name & classpath in a environment variable in a batchfile. Here 
I accidentally typed an extra space after the name of the driver. Therefor the 
driver could not be found. 

file:C:/cvsLocal/klantbarometer/schema.xml:48: Class Not Found: JDBC driver 
com.microsoft.jdbc.sqlserver.SQLServerDriver  could not be loaded

It took me an hour to find this, overlooking the extra space after the 
drivername.
Maybe an idea to do a trim() on the parameters of the sql-task (and maybe 
others).

In many cases trimming is not desireable IMHO.  It may seems unlikely, but there
always is a chance that people really want/have files with names ending with a
space for example.

Less generally speaking.  For attributes that we know will be used as class names,
trimming would be fine as spaces are not legal in class names.  I'm just not
sure whether we really want to go from consistent behavior "Ant never trims any
attribute values" to something far more difficult to describe - and to maintain.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
peterreilly@apache.org
text:
Whitespace in names is always an hard problem to debug, especially trailing
whitespace in property files.
However, names do allow trailing whitespace and at the core ant
level it not possible to figure out which is which.
Thinking of marking as WONTFIX as it would be difficult
to go through each and every use where a classname is used, and inconsistent
if one did not.
However, the change is not too big, so made the change.
